ns7:component-version-script.description: Configure repo and install Apache server
ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
yum --nogpgcheck -y clean all yum --nogpgcheck -y install httpd
# Ports on which to listen sed -ie "s/^Listen .*/Listen $http_port\nListen $http_proxy_port/g" /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf
# set up auto-start on booting chkconfig httpd on

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
if [ ! "$http_port" == "" ]; then echo "Adding static site configuration on port $http_port"
cat >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf << EOF
<VirtualHost *:$http_port> DocumentRoot /var/www/html ServerName localhost </VirtualHost>
EOF
# Copy the default index page into place cp /var/www/error/noindex.html /var/www/html/index.html fi
if [ ! "$http_node_ips" == "None" ]; then SUBSTR=""
if [ "$use_ajp" == "YES" ]; then for (( i = 0 ; i < ${#http_node_ips[@]} ; i++ )); do SUBSTR="$SUBSTR"$'\n'"BalancerMember ajp://${http_node_ips[$i]}:${http_node_port} route=${appsrv_routes[$i]}" done echo "Proxy load balancer ajp config: "$SUBSTR
cat >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf << EOF LoadModule proxy_ajp_module modules/mod_proxy_ajp.so <VirtualHost *:$http_proxy_port> <Proxy balancer://mycluster> $SUBSTR </Proxy> ProxyPass /$ajp_proxy_context balancer://mycluster/$tomcat_context </VirtualHost>
EOF else for (( i = 0 ; i < ${#http_node_ips[@]} ; i++ )); do SUBSTR="$SUBSTR"$'\n'"BalancerMember http://${http_node_ips[$i]}:${http_node_port} route=${appsrv_routes[$i]}" done echo "Proxy load balancer config: "$SUBSTR
COOKIE_HEADER_DIRECTIVE="" STICKY_SESSION_NAME="JSESSIONID|jsessionid" if [ "$autogen_sticky_cookie" == "YES" ]; then STICKY_SESSION_NAME="ROUTEID" COOKIE_HEADER_DIRECTIVE="Header add Set-Cookie \"ROUTEID=.%{BALANCER_WORKER_ROUTE}e; path=/\" env=BALANCER_ROUTE_CHANGED" fi
cat >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf << EOF <VirtualHost *:$http_proxy_port> <Proxy balancer://mycluster> $SUBSTR </Proxy> ProxyPass / balancer://mycluster/ stickysession=$STICKY_SESSION_NAME nofailover=On ProxyPassReverse / balancer://mycluster/ ProxyPreserveHost On $COOKIE_HEADER_DIRECTIVE </VirtualHost>
EOF fi
else echo "Proxy load balancer disabled" fi

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash
echo "Start Apache server UPDATE on http_port, http_proxy_port, and/or http_node_port."
# Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Remove all the settings and set up with the new properits values. CONF_FILE="/etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf" LINE_NUM=`grep -n "^<VirtualHost .*" ${CONF_FILE} | sed -n 's/^\([0-9]*\)[:].*/\1/p' | sed -n '1p'` if [ ! ${LINE_NUM} == "" ]; then sed -ie "${LINE_NUM},\$"'d' ${CONF_FILE} fi
# Start re-configuration if [ ! "$http_port" == "" ]; then echo "Adding static site configuration on port $http_port"
cat >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf << EOF
<VirtualHost *:$http_port> DocumentRoot /var/www/html ServerName localhost </VirtualHost>
EOF
fi
if [ ! "$http_node_ips" == "None" ]; then SUBSTR=""
if [ "$use_ajp" == "YES" ]; then for (( i = 0 ; i < ${#http_node_ips[@]} ; i++ )); do SUBSTR="$SUBSTR"$'\n'"BalancerMember ajp://${http_node_ips[$i]}:${http_node_port} route=${appsrv_routes[$i]}" done echo "Proxy load balancer ajp config: "$SUBSTR
cat >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf << EOF LoadModule proxy_ajp_module modules/mod_proxy_ajp.so <VirtualHost *:$http_proxy_port> <Proxy balancer://mycluster> $SUBSTR </Proxy> ProxyPass /$ajp_proxy_context balancer://mycluster/$tomcat_context </VirtualHost>
EOF else for (( i = 0 ; i < ${#http_node_ips[@]} ; i++ )); do SUBSTR="$SUBSTR"$'\n'"BalancerMember http://${http_node_ips[$i]}:${http_node_port} route=${appsrv_routes[$i]}" done echo "Proxy load balancer config: "$SUBSTR
COOKIE_HEADER_DIRECTIVE="" STICKY_SESSION_NAME="JSESSIONID|jsessionid" if [ "$autogen_sticky_cookie" == "YES" ]; then STICKY_SESSION_NAME="ROUTEID" COOKIE_HEADER_DIRECTIVE="Header add Set-Cookie \"ROUTEID=.%{BALANCER_WORKER_ROUTE}e; path=/\" env=BALANCER_ROUTE_CHANGED" fi
cat >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf << EOF <VirtualHost *:$http_proxy_port> <Proxy balancer://mycluster> $SUBSTR </Proxy> ProxyPass / balancer://mycluster/ stickysession=$STICKY_SESSION_NAME nofailover=On ProxyPassReverse / balancer://mycluster/ ProxyPreserveHost On $COOKIE_HEADER_DIRECTIVE </VirtualHost>
EOF fi
else echo "Proxy load balancer disabled" fi
# restart httpd service service httpd restart
echo "Finished Apache server UPDATE"

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:$PATH
# Need JDK not JRE try yum -y install java-1.6.0-openjdk-devel try update-alternatives --auto java
# What is this for?? if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then if [ -x /usr/sbin/setenforce ]; then /usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive else echo 'SELinux is enabled.This may cause installation to fail.' fi fi
#### ADDING THE DEDICATED GROUP AND WEBLOGIC USER echo "Adding WebLogic User" groupadd $wl_group try useradd -g $wl_group -d $bea_home $wl_admin_user echo -e "$wl_admin_password\n$wl_admin_password" | passwd $wl_admin_user if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo "Failed to set password for $wl_admin_user" exit -1 fi echo "Adding WebLogic User DONE"
#Basic Directory Structure try mkdir -p $wl_home try mkdir $wl_tmp_files_dir
echo "Setting up keys" cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/setup_keys.cmd << EOF mkdir ~/.ssh cp $weblogic_pkey ~/.ssh/id_rsa cat $weblogic_pubkey > ~/.ssh/authorized_keys cat > ~/.ssh/config << EOF2 Host * UserKnownHostsFile /dev/null StrictHostKeyChecking no EOF2 chmod -R 400 ~/.ssh/* chmod 500 ~/.ssh EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \". $wl_tmp_files_dir/setup_keys.cmd\" echo "Setting up keys done"
#### Setup mod_wl to support WL cluster echo "Setting up WebLogic's Apache mod_wl!"
clusterLen=${#wl_cluster_nodes[@]} if [[ $clusterLen == 0 ]]; then echo "No cluster entries found in wl_cluster_nodes" exit 1; fi;
webLogicCluster="${wl_cluster_nodes[0]}:${wl_managed_server_port}"
echo "Copying $mod_wl_so to $httpd_dir/modules/$mod_wl_so_name" try cp -f $mod_wl_so $httpd_dir/modules/$mod_wl_so_name
for (( i=1; i<$clusterLen; i++ )); do webLogicCluster="${webLogicCluster},${wl_cluster_nodes[$i]}:${wl_managed_server_port}" done echo "WebLogicCluster set to: $webLogicCluster"
if [[ ! -d "/var/log/httpd" ]]; then echo "/var/log/httpd doesn't exist, creating..." try mkdir -p "/var/log/httpd" fi
echo "Modifying $config_httpd_conf" cat >> $config_httpd_conf << EOF
#### WebLogic Plugin #### LoadModule weblogic_module modules/$mod_wl_so_name
<IfModule mod_weblogic.c> WebLogicCluster $webLogicCluster Debug ALL DebugConfigInfo ON WLLogFile /var/log/httpd/wl-proxy.log </IfModule>
<Location $wl_lb_path> SetHandler weblogic-handler PathTrim $wl_lb_path DefaultFileName $wl_default_fn </Location> EOF
echo "Checking if changes are good..." try apachectl -t
echo "Restarting Apache..." try service httpd restart echo "Done!"

ns7:component-version-script.description: Script to install Weblogic Application Service 12c
ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:$PATH
# Need JDK not JRE try yum -y install java-1.6.0-openjdk-devel try update-alternatives --auto java
# What is this for?? if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then if [ -x /usr/sbin/setenforce ]; then /usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive else echo 'SELinux is enabled.This may cause installation to fail.' fi fi
#########SCRIPT INTERNAL PARAMETERS######################## . $weblogic_common
#### ADDING THE DEDICATED GROUP AND WEBLOGIC USER echo "Adding WebLogic User" groupadd $wl_group try useradd -g $wl_group -d $bea_home $wl_admin_user echo -e "$wl_admin_password\n$wl_admin_password" | passwd $wl_admin_user if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo "Failed to set password for $wl_admin_user" exit -1 fi echo "Adding WebLogic User DONE"
#Basic Directory Structure try mkdir -p $wl_home try mkdir $wl_tmp_files_dir
echo "Setting up keys" cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/setup_keys.cmd << EOF mkdir ~/.ssh cp $weblogic_pkey ~/.ssh/id_rsa cat $weblogic_pubkey > ~/.ssh/authorized_keys cat > ~/.ssh/config << EOF2 Host * UserKnownHostsFile /dev/null StrictHostKeyChecking no EOF2 chmod -R 400 ~/.ssh/* chmod 500 ~/.ssh EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \". $wl_tmp_files_dir/setup_keys.cmd\" echo "Setting up keys done"
export wl_config="$bea_home/weblogic_silent.install.xml" echo "Creating $wl_config" try cat > $wl_config << EOF <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <bea-installer> <input-fields> <data-value name="BEAHOME" value="$bea_home" /> <data-value name="WLS_INSTALL_DIR" value="$wl_home" /> <data-value name="WLW_INSTALL_DIR" value="$wl_home" /> <data-value name="COMPONENT_PATHS" value="WebLogic Server|Oracle Coherence" /> <data-value name="INSTALL_NODE_MANAGER_SERVICE" value="no" /> <data-value name="NODEMGR_PORT" value="5559" /> </input-fields> </bea-installer> EOF echo "weblogic_silent.install.xml created"
echo "Installing WebLogic Server" try java -jar $weblogic_installer -mode=silent -silent_xml=$wl_config -log=install.log
echo "Removing sample domains to avoid them being picked up" echo "execing rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/wl_server" rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/wl_server echo "execing rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec-spring" rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec-spring echo "execing rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec" rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec
chown -R $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $bea_home chmod 700 $wl_home
echo "Installed Successfully"

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/sh
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
# Weblogic Common import . $weblogic_common
export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java" export WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME="$wl_home/common/nodemanager" export WL_JAR="$wl_home/server/lib/weblogic.jar" export WL_HOME=$wl_home export WL_DOMAIN_PATH="$wl_home/user_projects/domains/$wl_domain" export WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR="$wl_home/user_projects/domains/$wl_domain/servers/AdminServer" export JAVA_OPTIONS="-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -Xverify:none -Xms512m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=350m -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=64m -XX:+UseCodeCacheFlushing" export PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR="$bea_home/packed_domains" export TEMPLATE_FILE=$PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR/${wl_domain}.jar export JAVA_OPTS=$JAVA_OPTIONS export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:.
try $wl_home/server/bin/setWLSEnv.sh
## Get and unpack the domain created in AdminServerSetup echo "Retrieving packed directory from AdminServer" cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/scp_domain.cmd << EOF mkdir $PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR scp $wl_admin_user@$wl_admin_server_addr:$TEMPLATE_FILE $PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \". $wl_tmp_files_dir/scp_domain.cmd\" echo "Retrieve done for $TEMPLATE_FILE"
echo "Unpacking..." cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/unpack.cmd << EOF $wl_home/common/bin/unpack.sh -domain=$WL_DOMAIN_PATH -template=$TEMPLATE_FILE -log_priority=debug -log=unpack.log -overwrite_domain=true EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \". $wl_tmp_files_dir/unpack.cmd\" echo "Unpacking completed to $TEMPLATE_FILE"

ns7:component-version-script.script:
!/bin/sh
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
# Weblogic Common import . $weblogic_common
#### START INSTALL SCRIPTS COMMON #### export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:$PATH # After weblogic is installed and the jdk is downloaded and updated this is where it is. It isn't set in our environment though. export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java" export WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME="$wl_home/common/nodemanager" export WL_JAR="$wl_home/server/lib/weblogic.jar" export WL_HOME=$wl_home export WL_DOMAIN_PATH="$wl_home/user_projects/domains/$wl_domain" export WL_SERVERS_PATH="$WL_DOMAIN_PATH/servers" export WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR="$WL_SERVERS_PATH/AdminServer" export JAVA_OPTIONS="${JAVA_OPTIONS} -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -Xverify:none -Xms512m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=64m -XX:+UseCodeCacheFlushing -Dssl.debug=true -Dweblogic.nodemanager.sslHostNameVerificationEnabled=false -Dweblogic.security.SSL.enforceConstraints=off" export PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR="$bea_home/packed_domains" export TEMPLATE_FILE=$PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR/${wl_domain}.jar export JAVA_OPTS="${JAVA_OPTS} $JAVA_OPTIONS" export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:. export ADMIN_SERVER_URL="t3://$wl_admin_server_addr:$wl_admin_server_port" try $wl_home/server/bin/setWLSEnv.sh
# For dealing with WebLogic BUG 13658083 try mkdir -p $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/endorsed try cp -f $wl_home/endorsed/* $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/endorsed #### END INSTALL SCRIPTS COMMON #### try chown -R $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $wl_home
#### Generate common config.py with some common stuff try cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSconfigCommon.py << EOF from java.util import * from javax.management import * import sys, traceback
theServerLog = "$WL_DOMAIN_PATH" + "/servers/$wl_admin_server_name/logs/AdminServer.log" adminServerURL = "$ADMIN_SERVER_URL" adminHTTPURL = "http://$wl_admin_server_addr:$wl_admin_server_port"
def nodeManagerConnect(): nmConnect("$wl_node_manager_user", "$wl_node_manager_password", "$wl_node_manager_addr", $wl_node_manager_port, "$wl_domain", "$WL_DOMAIN_PATH", "plain", "true") return
def shutdownNodeManager(): print "Stopping the Node Manager" try: stopNodeManager() except weblogic.rjvm.PeerGoneException: print "Connection closed." return EOF
#### Set nodemanager configuration and wrapper script that is called by nodemanager when the managedserver is to be started echo "Generating the nodemanager configuration" # Setup Node Manager NM_PROPS_FILE="$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME/nodemanager.properties" try cat > $NM_PROPS_FILE << EOF WeblogicHome=$wl_home NodeManagerHome=$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME DomainsFile=$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME/nodemanager.domains ListenAddress=$wl_node_manager_addr ListenPort=$wl_node_manager_port LogFile=$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME/nodemanager.log LogLimit=0 DomainsDirRemoteSharingEnabled=false AuthenticationEnabled=false LogLevel=INFO DomainsFileEnabled=true StartScriptName=service_migration/nmStartManagedServer.sh # Not used, all info is defined in server setup NativeVersionEnabled=false LogToStderr=true SecureListener=false LogCount=1 DomainRegistrationEnabled=false StartScriptEnabled=false StopScriptEnabled=false QuitEnabled=true LogAppend=true StateCheckInterval=500 CrashRecoveryEnabled=false LogFormatter=weblogic.nodemanager.server.LogFormatter ListenBacklog=50 EOF chown $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $NM_PROPS_FILE
#### Enroll this machine with the AdminServer try cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSenroll.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSenroll.py << EOF try: print "Enrolling this machine with AdminServer" connect("$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", adminServerURL) nmEnroll("$WL_DOMAIN_PATH" , "$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME") print "Enrolled!" disconnect() except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSenroll.py\"
#### After enrolling if we are in production mode the AdminServer will give us some random properties, set them back echo "Generating the nodemanager startup.properties" # Startup properties required for actually getting it going #http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E24329_01/web.1211/e21050/nodemgr_config.htm#BHCJHHDC try mkdir -p $WL_SERVERS_PATH/$wl_managed_server_name/data/nodemanager try cat > $WL_SERVERS_PATH/$wl_managed_server_name/data/nodemanager/startup.properties << EOF JavaHome=$JAVA_HOME Arguments=$wl_managed_server_jvm_args -Djava.library.path=$wl_home/server/native/$wl_native_target SSLArguments=-Dweblogic.security.SSL.ignoreHostnameVerification\=true -Dweblogic.ReverseDNSAllowed\=false -Dweblogic.security.SSL.enforceConstraints\=off RestartMax=2 RestartDelaySeconds=0 RestartInterval=3600 AdminURL=$ADMIN_SERVER_URL AutoRestart=true AutoKillIfFailed=false EOF try chown $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $WL_SERVERS_PATH/$wl_managed_server_name/data/nodemanager/startup.properties
#Set boot.properties, if production mode looks like this is needed echo "Setting boot.properties" try cat > $WL_SERVERS_PATH/$wl_managed_server_name/data/nodemanager/boot.properties << EOF username=$wl_admin_user password=$wl_admin_password EOF try chown $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $WL_SERVERS_PATH/$wl_managed_server_name/data/nodemanager/boot.properties
#### NM Password try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"mkdir -p $WL_DOMAIN_PATH/config/nodemanager\" try cat > $WL_DOMAIN_PATH/config/nodemanager/nm_password.properties << EOF username=$wl_node_manager_user password=$wl_node_manager_password EOF try chown $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $WL_DOMAIN_PATH/config/nodemanager/nm_password.properties
# If we don't do this we possibly result in error echo "Removing $WL_SERVERS_PATH/$wl_managed_server_name/data/ldap" try rm -fr $WL_SERVERS_PATH/$wl_managed_server_name/data/ldap try chown -R $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $wl_home
#### Start the NodeManager now try cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSstartNodeManager.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSstartNodeManager.py << EOF try: print "Starting NodeManager" startNodeManager(verbose="true", NodeManagerHome="$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME", PropertiesFile="$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME/nodemanager.properties") nodeManagerConnect() nmDisconnect() except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSstartNodeManager.py\"
#### Finally need to start this managed server # Finally need to start this managed server cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSstartManagedServer.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSstartManagedServer.py << EOF try: print "Connecting to NodeManager" nmConnect("$wl_node_manager_user", "$wl_node_manager_password", "$wl_node_manager_addr", $wl_node_manager_port, "$wl_domain", "$WL_DOMAIN_PATH", "plain", "true") print "Connected to NodeManager. Starting ManagedServer: $wl_managed_server_name" nmStart("$wl_managed_server_name", "$WL_DOMAIN_PATH") print "ManagedServer started! Disconnecting" nmDisconnect()
#Test connections print "Testing NodeManager connection" nodeManagerConnect() nmDisconnect() print "NodeManager connection fine." print "Testing AdminServer connection" connect("$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", adminServerURL) disconnect() print "AdminServer connection fine."
except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installMSstartManagedServer.py\"

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/sh
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
# Weblogic Common import . $weblogic_common
#### START INSTALL SCRIPTS COMMON #### export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:$PATH # After weblogic is installed and the jdk is downloaded and updated this is where it is. It isn't set in our environment though. export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java" export WL_JAR="$wl_home/server/lib/weblogic.jar" export WL_HOME=$wl_home export WL_DOMAIN_PATH="$wl_home/user_projects/domains/$wl_domain" export WL_SERVERS_PATH="$WL_DOMAIN_PATH/servers" export JAVA_OPTS=$JAVA_OPTIONS export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:. try $wl_home/server/bin/setWLSEnv.sh # For dealing with WebLogic BUG 13658083 try mkdir -p $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/endorsed try cp -f $wl_home/endorsed/* $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/endorsed #### END INSTALL SCRIPTS COMMON ####
# Generate config.py with some common stuff try cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/setupMSaddCommon.py << EOF from java.util import * from javax.management import * import sys, traceback
adminServerURL = "t3://$wl_admin_server_addr:$wl_admin_server_port"
def saveAndActivate(): print "Save and activate changes" save() activate(block="true") #stopEdit("y") return
def editStartEdit(): print "Starting edit session" edit() startEdit(exclusive="true", waitTimeInMillis=36000) return
EOF
cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/setupMSaddCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/setupMSaddConfig.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/setupMSaddConfig.py << EOF try: # Connect running admin server print "Connecting to AdminServer" connect("$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", adminServerURL)
editStartEdit()
print "Create Machine: ${wl_managed_server_name}_machine" machine = cmo.createUnixMachine("${wl_managed_server_name}_machine") machine.setPostBindUIDEnabled(true) machine.setPostBindUID("$wl_admin_user") nodeManager = machine.getNodeManager() nodeManager.setListenAddress("$wl_node_manager_addr") nodeManager.setListenPort($wl_node_manager_port) nodeManager.setUserName("$wl_node_manager_user") nodeManager.setPassword("$wl_node_manager_password") nodeManager.setNodeManagerHome("$wl_home/common/nodemanager") nodeManager.setDebugEnabled(true) nodeManager.setNMType("plain")
print "Creating Managed Server: $wl_managed_server_name" server = cmo.createServer("$wl_managed_server_name") server.setListenAddress("$wl_managed_server_addr") server.setListenPort($wl_managed_server_port) server.setAutoRestart(true) server.setAutoKillIfFailed(true) server.setRestartMax(2) server.setRestartDelaySeconds(60) serverStartConfig = server.getServerStart() serverStartConfig.setBeaHome("$bea_home") serverStartConfig.setRootDirectory("$WL_DOMAIN_PATH") serverStartConfig.setUsername("$wl_managed_server_user") serverStartConfig.setPassword("$wl_managed_server_password") serverStartConfig.setJavaHome("$JAVA_HOME")
nativeLibJVMProp = "-Djava.library.path=$wl_home/server/native/$wl_native_target" serverStartConfig.setArguments("$wl_managed_server_jvm_args " + nativeLibJVMProp) #server.getServerStart().setJavaVendor("Oracle")
print "Add Managed Servers To Cluster" #assign("Server", "$wl_managed_server_name", "Cluster", "$wl_cluster_name") server.setCluster(getMBean("/Clusters/" + "$wl_cluster_name"))
print "Add Managed Servers To Machine" server.setMachine(machine)
saveAndActivate() disconnect()
except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
print "Exiting" exit() EOF
try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/setupMSaddConfig.py\"

ns7:component-version-script.description: Script to install Weblogic Application Service 12c
ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:$PATH
# Need JDK not JRE try yum -y install java-1.6.0-openjdk-devel try update-alternatives --auto java
# What is this for?? if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then if [ -x /usr/sbin/setenforce ]; then /usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive else echo 'SELinux is enabled.This may cause installation to fail.' fi fi
#########SCRIPT INTERNAL PARAMETERS######################## . $weblogic_common
#### ADDING THE DEDICATED GROUP AND WEBLOGIC USER echo "Adding WebLogic User" groupadd $wl_group try useradd -g $wl_group -d $bea_home $wl_admin_user echo -e "$wl_admin_password\n$wl_admin_password" | passwd $wl_admin_user if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo "Failed to set password for $wl_admin_user" exit -1 fi echo "Adding WebLogic User DONE"
#Basic Directory Structure try mkdir -p $wl_home try mkdir $wl_tmp_files_dir
echo "Setting up keys" cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/setup_keys.cmd << EOF mkdir ~/.ssh cp $weblogic_pkey ~/.ssh/id_rsa cat $weblogic_pubkey > ~/.ssh/authorized_keys cat > ~/.ssh/config << EOF2 Host * UserKnownHostsFile /dev/null StrictHostKeyChecking no EOF2 chmod -R 400 ~/.ssh/* chmod 500 ~/.ssh EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \". $wl_tmp_files_dir/setup_keys.cmd\" echo "Setting up keys done"
export wl_config="$bea_home/weblogic_silent.install.xml" echo "Creating $wl_config" try cat > $wl_config << EOF <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <bea-installer> <input-fields> <data-value name="BEAHOME" value="$bea_home" /> <data-value name="WLS_INSTALL_DIR" value="$wl_home" /> <data-value name="WLW_INSTALL_DIR" value="$wl_home" /> <data-value name="COMPONENT_PATHS" value="WebLogic Server|Oracle Coherence" /> <data-value name="INSTALL_NODE_MANAGER_SERVICE" value="no" /> <data-value name="NODEMGR_PORT" value="5559" /> </input-fields> </bea-installer> EOF echo "weblogic_silent.install.xml created"
echo "Installing WebLogic Server" try java -jar $weblogic_installer -mode=silent -silent_xml=$wl_config -log=install.log
echo "Removing sample domains to avoid them being picked up" echo "execing rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/wl_server" rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/wl_server echo "execing rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec-spring" rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec-spring echo "execing rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec" rm -fr $wl_home/samples/domains/medrec
chown -R $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $bea_home chmod 700 $wl_home
echo "Installed Successfully"

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/sh
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
# Weblogic Common import . $weblogic_common
#### START INSTALL SCRIPTS COMMON #### export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:$PATH # After weblogic is installed and the jdk is downloaded and updated this is where it is. It isn't set in our environment though. export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java" export WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME="$wl_home/common/nodemanager" export WL_JAR="$wl_home/server/lib/weblogic.jar" export WL_HOME=$wl_home export WL_DOMAIN_PATH="$wl_home/user_projects/domains/$wl_domain" export WL_SERVERS_PATH="$WL_DOMAIN_PATH/servers" export WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR="$WL_SERVERS_PATH/AdminServer" export JAVA_OPTIONS="-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -Xverify:none -Xms512m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=350m -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=64m -XX:+UseCodeCacheFlushing -Dssl.debug=true -Dweblogic.nodemanager.sslHostNameVerificationEnabled=false -Dweblogic.security.SSL.enforceConstraints=off" export PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR="$bea_home/packed_domains" export TEMPLATE_FILE=$PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR/${wl_domain}.jar export JAVA_OPTS=$JAVA_OPTIONS export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:. try $wl_home/server/bin/setWLSEnv.sh # For dealing with WebLogic BUG 13658083 try mkdir -p $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/endorsed try cp -f $wl_home/endorsed/* $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/endorsed #### END INSTALL SCRIPTS COMMON ####
#### Generate config.py with some common stuff try cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASconfigCommon.py << EOF from java.util import * from javax.management import * import sys, traceback
theDomainPath = "$WL_DOMAIN_PATH" nodeManagerHome = "$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME" theServerLog = theDomainPath + "/servers/$wl_admin_server_name/logs/AdminServer.log" adminServerURL = "t3://$wl_admin_server_addr:$wl_admin_server_port"
def saveAndActivate(): print "Save and activate changes" save() activate(block="true") #stopEdit("y") return
def editStartEdit(): print "Starting edit session" edit() startEdit(exclusive="true", waitTimeInMillis=36000) return
def startAdminServer(): print "Starting AdminServer" startServer("$wl_admin_server_name", "$wl_domain", adminServerURL, "$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", theDomainPath, timeout=360000, systemProperties="java.endorsed.dirs=$wl_home/endorsed", jvmArgs="$wl_managed_server_jvm_args") return
def shutdownAdminServer(): print "Shutdown The Admin Server" try: shutdown(name="$wl_admin_server_name", force="true", block="true") except weblogic.rjvm.PeerGoneException: print "Connection closed." except: e = sys.exc_info()[0] print "Unknown error: %(error)s" % {"error":e} return EOF
#### Build the AdminServer relevant parts cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASbuildConfig.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASbuildConfig.py << EOF try: print "Reading template: $wl_home/common/templates/domains/wls.jar" readTemplate("$wl_home/common/templates/domains/wls.jar") print "Reading template done" setOption("DomainName", "$wl_domain") setOption("OverwriteDomain", "true") setOption("ServerStartMode", "prod") cd("/Security/base_domain/User/weblogic") #cmo.setName("$wl_admin_user") cmo.setUserPassword("$wl_admin_password") cd("/") print "Writing domain: %(domain)s" % {"domain":theDomainPath} writeDomain(theDomainPath)
#Start the Admin Server startAdminServer()
print "Connecting to AdminServer" connect("$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", adminServerURL)
editStartEdit()
print "Disable Hostname Verification" cd("/Servers/$wl_admin_server_name/SSL/$wl_admin_server_name") cmo.setHostnameVerificationIgnored(true) cmo.setHostnameVerifier("None") cmo.setTwoWaySSLEnabled(false) cmo.setClientCertificateEnforced(false) cd("/")
print "Create Cluster: $wl_cluster_name" cluster = cmo.createCluster("$wl_cluster_name") cluster.setClusterMessagingMode("unicast")
print "Create Data Source" datasource = cmo.createJDBCSystemResource("$ds_name") jdbcResource = datasource.getJDBCResource() jdbcResource.setName("$ds_name") targets = [getMBean("/Clusters/" + "$wl_cluster_name")] datasource.setTargets(targets) dataSourceParams = jdbcResource.getJDBCDataSourceParams() names = ["jdbc/$ds_name"] dataSourceParams.setJNDINames(names) dataSourceParams.setGlobalTransactionsProtocol("$db_proto") driverParams = jdbcResource.getJDBCDriverParams() driverParams.setUrl("$DB_URL") driverParams.setDriverName("$db_driver") driverParams.setPassword("$db_password") driverProperties = driverParams.getProperties() driverProperties.createProperty("user") userProperty = driverProperties.lookupProperty("user") userProperty.setValue("$db_username") driverProperties.createProperty("databaseName") dbNameProperty = driverProperties.lookupProperty("databaseName") dbNameProperty.setValue("$db_name") connectionPoolParams = jdbcResource.getJDBCConnectionPoolParams() connectionPoolParams.setTestTableName("$db_test_table") connectionPoolParams.setConnectionCreationRetryFrequencySeconds(100)
saveAndActivate() shutdownAdminServer() except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASbuildConfig.py\"
# Admin server needs boot properties if [[ ! -d $WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR/security ]]; then try mkdir $WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR/security fi try cat > $WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR/security/boot.properties << EOF username=$wl_admin_user password=$wl_admin_password EOF chown -R $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR
# Test that it is fine cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASStartAdminServer.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASStartAdminServer.py << EOF try: # Start Admin Server and check to connect startAdminServer() print "AdminServer up, checking connection." connect("$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", adminServerURL) disconnect() print "AdminServer connection check fine."
except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASStartAdminServer.py\"
## NodeManager echo "Generating the nodemanager configuration" NM_PROPS_FILE="$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME/nodemanager.properties" try cat > $NM_PROPS_FILE << EOF WeblogicHome=$wl_home NodeManagerHome=$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME DomainsFile=$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME/nodemanager.domains ListenAddress=$wl_node_manager_addr ListenPort=$wl_node_manager_port LogFile=$WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME/nodemanager.log LogLimit=0 DomainsDirRemoteSharingEnabled=false AuthenticationEnabled=false LogLevel=INFO DomainsFileEnabled=true StartScriptName=service_migration/$msStartScript NativeVersionEnabled=false LogToStderr=true SecureListener=false LogCount=1 DomainRegistrationEnabled=false StartScriptEnabled=false StopScriptEnabled=false QuitEnabled=true LogAppend=true StateCheckInterval=500 CrashRecoveryEnabled=false LogFormatter=weblogic.nodemanager.server.LogFormatter ListenBacklog=50 EOF chown $wl_admin_user:$wl_group $NM_PROPS_FILE
# Now need to start NodeManager cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASstartNodeManager.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASstartNodeManager.py << EOF try: print "Starting NodeManager" startNodeManager(verbose="true", NodeManagerHome=nodeManagerHome) print "Connecting to NodeManager" nmConnect("$wl_node_manager_user", "$wl_node_manager_password", "$wl_node_manager_addr", $wl_node_manager_port, "$wl_domain", "$WL_DOMAIN_PATH", "plain", "true") nmDisconnect() except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installASstartNodeManager.py\"

#!/bin/sh
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
# Weblogic Common import . $weblogic_common
export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java" export WL_NODEMANAGER_HOME="$wl_home/common/nodemanager" export WL_JAR="$wl_home/server/lib/weblogic.jar" export WL_HOME=$wl_home export WL_DOMAIN_PATH="$wl_home/user_projects/domains/$wl_domain" export WL_DOMAIN_AS_DIR="$wl_home/user_projects/domains/$wl_domain/servers/AdminServer" export JAVA_OPTIONS="-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -Xverify:none -Xms512m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=350m -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=64m -XX:+UseCodeCacheFlushing" export PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR="$bea_home/packed_domains" export TEMPLATE_FILE=$PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR/${wl_domain}.jar export JAVA_OPTS=$JAVA_OPTIONS export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:.
try $wl_home/server/bin/setWLSEnv.sh
echo "Packing domain $wl_domain" cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/pack.cmd << EOF test -d $PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR || mkdir $PACKED_DOMAINS_DIR test ! -f $TEMPLATE_FILE || rm -f $TEMPLATE_FILE $wl_home/common/bin/pack.sh -managed=true -domain=$WL_DOMAIN_PATH -template=$TEMPLATE_FILE -template_name=$wl_domain -log_priority=debug -log=pack.log EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \". $wl_tmp_files_dir/pack.cmd\"
echo "Package completed to $TEMPLATE_FILE"

#!/bin/sh
# Import global conf . $global_conf
# Common import . $common_utils
# Weblogic Common import . $weblogic_common
export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:$PATH export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java" export WL_JAR="$wl_home/server/lib/weblogic.jar" export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:. try $wl_home/server/bin/setWLSEnv.sh
#### Generate config.py with some common stuff try cat > $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBconfigCommon.py << EOF from java.util import * from javax.management import * import sys, traceback
adminServerURL = "t3://$wl_admin_server_addr:$wl_admin_server_port"
EOF
#### Add users and groups for dukesbank app cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBaddDukesBankUsers.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBaddDukesBankUsers.py << EOF realmName = "myrealm" #Default realm created by WL configInfo = [ {"user":"200","userDesc":"Dukesbank Customer","password":"foobar123","group":"bankCustomer","groupDesc":"Dukesbank Customer Group"}, {"user":"201","userDesc":"Dukesbank Admin","password":"foobar123","group":"bankAdmin","groupDesc":"Dukesbank Admin Group"} ]
try: print "Connecting to AdminServer" connect("$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", adminServerURL) serverConfig() cd("/SecurityConfiguration/$wl_domain" + "/Realms/" + realmName + "/AuthenticationProviders/DefaultAuthenticator") for config in configInfo: print "Creating group: " + config["group"] + " description: " + config["groupDesc"] cmo.createGroup(config["group"], config["groupDesc"]) print "Creating user: " + config["user"] + " description: " + config["userDesc"] cmo.createUser(config["user"], config["password"], config["userDesc"]) print "Adding user: " + config["user"] + " to group: " + config["group"] cmo.addMemberToGroup(config["group"], config["user"]) except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
disconnect() exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBaddDukesBankUsers.py\"
#### Deploy the ear cp $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBconfigCommon.py $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBdeployDBEar.py try cat >> $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBdeployDBEar.py << EOF dukesBankApp = "dukesbank" try: print "Connecting to AdminServer" connect("$wl_admin_user", "$wl_admin_password", adminServerURL) print "Deploying $dukesbank_ear to cluster: $wl_cluster_name" deploy(dukesBankApp, "$dukesbank_ear", targets="$wl_cluster_name") print "Starting " + dukesBankApp + " application..." startApplication(dukesBankApp) print "Started!" disconnect() except: apply(traceback.print_exception, sys.exc_info()) dumpStack() exit(exitcode=-1)
exit() EOF try su - $wl_admin_user -p -c \"java -cp $WL_JAR:$CLASSPATH weblogic.WLST $wl_tmp_files_dir/installDBdeployDBEar.py\"

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Fix the linux-firmware package export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y linux-firmware < /dev/console > /dev/console # Install MySQL package apt-get install -y mysql-server else yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install -x MySQL-server-community mysql-server fi

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family

ns7:component-version-script.description: UPDATE-lifecycle script for changing the MySQL properties
ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # This is the UPDATE lifecycle script for MySql service to update db_port. # If other properties are changed, the script will need to be adjusted accordingly.
echo "MyAQL server UPDATE to update db_port"
# Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# stop the mysql service before updating the port number if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql stop else service mysqld stop fi
# update listening port sed -ie "s/port=[0-9]*/port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
# start the mysql service after updating the port number if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql start else service mysqld start fi
echo "Finished MySQL Server UPDATE"

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin #Create database needed for Dukes bank
# store the current db username in a local file for UPDATE script to use USER_FILE_DIR=/tmp/mysql/dukesbank mkdir -p ${USER_FILE_DIR} echo "${db_username}" > ${USER_FILE_DIR}/dukes_bank_user
# duke's bank's db script INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE=init_db_script_file.sql echo "create user '${db_username}'@'localhost' identified by '${db_password}';" > $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE echo "create user '${db_username}' identified by '${db_password}';" >> $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE echo "create database ${sample_db};" >> $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE echo "grant all privileges on ${sample_db}.* to '${db_username}'@'%' identified by '${db_password}';" >> $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE echo "grant all privileges on ${sample_db}.* to '${db_username}' identified by '${db_password}';" >> $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE echo "flush privileges;" >> $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE
echo "USE ${sample_db};" >> $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE echo "source ${initialize_db_script};" >> $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE mysql -u$init_db_username -p$init_db_password < $INIT_DB_SCRIPT_FILE

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash
echo "Starting initialize-db-script:UPDATE to update db_username and db_password."
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin
echo "Get the old user db name" USER_FILE=/tmp/mysql/dukesbank/dukes_bank_user DB_OLD_USERNAME=`cat ${USER_FILE}` echo "And store the new db user name" echo "${db_username}" > ${USER_FILE}
echo "Updating username to '${db_username}'@'localhost'"
RENAME_USER_SCRIPT_FILE=rename_user_script_file.sql echo "rename user '${DB_OLD_USERNAME}'@'localhost' to '${db_username}'@'localhost';" > $RENAME_USER_SCRIPT_FILE echo "rename user '${DB_OLD_USERNAME}' to '${db_username}';" >> $RENAME_USER_SCRIPT_FILE mysql -u$init_db_username -p$init_db_password < $RENAME_USER_SCRIPT_FILE
echo "Updating db user password for '${db_username}'@'localhost'"
UPDATE_PASSWORD_SCRIPT_FILE=update_password_script_file.sql echo "set password for '${db_username}'@'localhost' = password('${db_password}');" > $UPDATE_PASSWORD_SCRIPT_FILE echo "set password for '${db_username}' = password('${db_password}');" >> $UPDATE_PASSWORD_SCRIPT_FILE echo "Calling mysql with script $UPDATE_PASSWORD_SCRIPT_FILE " mysql -u$init_db_username -p$init_db_password < $UPDATE_PASSWORD_SCRIPT_FILE
echo "finished initialize-db-script:UPDATE"
